TopicTitle: The funniest text you encountered in KSP

Articles.Content:
The most amused me EVA report after Mun landing

"You start say something dramatic and poignant about the plight of Kerbal-kind in this grand universe, only to be cut off by random radio chatter that the situation is normal"

It make me laugh a lot:D

"You take a sample of water, it appears to dramatically increase the surface humidity of anything it touches"

A surface sample in the ocean XD
I like how the Materials Bay judges you when you use it on the launchpad.
I like this one when you do an EVA report on Eeloo: "You lay down and give the planet a hug, just so it knows it's not alone out here."

"You just can't help but like Ike."

Eisenhower campaign reference FTW, baby.

I also like the "2001" reference when you're near Jool.

Just now, the loading screen had the following:

Adding K to every word.

the loading screen.

And the like ike quote.

"Recombobulating discombobulator."

Science has some real gems in there too. I love games that have some fun with the flavour text.

Just now: "This might be an atmosphere, but its definitely something you dont want to breathe"

lol

"You take a sample of water, it appears to dramatically increase the surface humidity of anything it touches"

A surface sample in the ocean XD

This is one of my favorites.

Another is taking an eva sample on Duna. I cannot remember the entire wording but it had something to do with the red sand staining the suits and considering pink spacesuits for the mission to save on dry cleaning.

"You just can't help but like Ike."

Eisenhower campaign reference FTW, baby.

I also like the "2001" reference when you're near Jool.

Really? It's crew report or experiment. Can you tell my what is about?

The 2001 reference while orbiting Jool made my day. It especially fit because I'd sent a lone probe out there to do a "grand tour" of as many planets as possible and Jool was the last, lonely stop before it ran out of power...

Just now: "This might be an atmosphere, but its definitely something you dont want to breathe"

lol

The EVA reports on Laythe are also hilarious.

Not really funny, but Bop has some spooky stuff going on...

Really? It's crew report or experiment. Can you tell my what is about?

It's the experiment results you get from using the Science Jr. materials bay in Jool orbit. There's another 2001 reference that not a lot of people know about as well, if you do a materials study on the surface of Dres.

Really? It's crew report or experiment. Can you tell my what is about?

Here's the "2001" reference.

Here's the "2001" reference.

"Open the bay door" nice i love the 2001: Space Odyssey

"I'm sorry Dave, I'm afraid I can't do that"
Sometimes When In EVA Around The Earth It Says Something Like This: "I Think It's Better To Stay in The Ship" XD
"It's very... round"
"Looking at the surface of Minmus reminds you of a favorite childhood dessert. You are tempted to taste the surface..."

Some of the science texts are great but I don't think you can beat a certain part of the part description of the good old RT-10 SRB:

"The RT-10 is used in many space programs, whenever the need to save cash is greater than the need to keep astronauts alive."
"warranty,void if an engineer admits its actually a store-bought model with wires attached". Always cracks me up ^-^
you feel bit like a super hero when you jump in low gravity:D

"Yep, it's dirt"

-Surface sample from Kerbin grasslands.

The description on the atmosphere-meter-thing:

"Warranty void if exposed to vacuum or air" or something of that sort. XD

About the turbojet engine :

"Designed for high atmospheric performance...[...] C7 engineers assure us all those leaks stop once it gets up there"

I also like the one in space near Kerbin : "The sky seems to be mosly below us"

Apart from that the part descriptions in the VAB are all very funny
